text: Spanish is a million times more understandable than Glasgow patter. No one's claiming Spanish to be English, at least.

name: possums
text:
But it just doesn't make sense. Do you actually say "-lising?" I assume you don't, because every British person I've met (all... five) say "-lizing" just like Americans. It's just written dishonestly.

Don't get me wrong, I'm trolling you, because American English is full of bullshit too. (And yes, there are a TON of stupid Americans.) You should just understand that it goes both ways.

Unless of course you're still upset about losing a war to a rag-tag coalition of the best dern states this United America ever did see *crying eagle*

name: gitarooman
text:
This is not how copyright law works. At least in the United States. Intellectual Property remains the exclusive right of its creator until 70 years after the creator's death, or 95 years from creation/120 years from publication (whichever is sooner) for works copyrighted by corporations (eg. Mickey Mouse). However this will change soon, seeing as how the US government will not let Mickey Mouse enter the public domain. Copyright term was life 50 until Mickey was going to do exactly that in the late 70s, leading to the Sonny Bono Act.

Also that is not how music royalties work. Royalties are paid by record companies (not end-users) to performers (not songwriters). How do you think people like Britney Spears who don't write their own songs make so much money? Royalties for the underlying copyright are a different matter altogether, and are often not referred to by that name in front of lay-people.

The more you know.

name: thegoblins
text: I feel like Mickey's on the decline nowadays though.  I mean, I'm not sure he has the pull to keep himself away from the groundlings' reach next time his copyright wears off.

name: ryder-p-moses
text:
The day Mickey becomes free for all will mark the definitive turning point where we can say the American empire has fallen with no hope of recovery.

Serious Washington will be burning with naked Saxons running through the streets raping and pillaging before Disney's copyrights ever expire. We may have to revive the Saxons through cloning in order to achieve this sequence of events.

name: belgand
text: True. Any person who actually would watch a Mickey short frightens me. Any person who would do so when a viable Looney Tunes short of some type was also available probably also intends to rape my livestock until they expire.

name: neonfreon
text:
as a modern parent, i have all the mickey shorts and all the looney tunes shorts in AVI. over the years, i'm sure you've all come to trust me as a great critic of art, so i offer my judgment for your perusal.

* looney tunes is the rudest, crudest, "lets be complete assholes to each other for absolutely no reason at all" kind of cartoons you'll ever see.
* disney mickey/pluto/donald etc shorts are generally pussy shit in comparison. problems are caused by people's ineptitude, or nature's lack of cooperation. When there is people vs. people conflict, there is usually some justification of it.
* they're both infinitely better than Lilo & Stich or Spongebob Squarepants or Clifford the Big Red Dog because they don't have the whole "bad people are people too and just need more love" or "it's ok for men to be feminine" or "let's make sure to put a lot of handicapped characters in the show, not bring up that they're handicapped, just show them doing awesome things so kids learn handicapped people are just normal people" type messages. Your kids may learn how to be better assholes by watching looney tunes, but they were assholes to begin with.

name: hatstand_mcq
text:
You know, at first I found you using thegoblins' face quite funny. But it's now getting to the point where it's a bit creepy. It's like if you put on a girl's alice band to pose for a picture that's just good natured larking around, but if you take said hairband home, and always wear it, despite barely knowing the girl in question, it becomes bloody unsavoury.
So, I suppose, congratulations. At first my relaxed good humour rendered me immune to your trollery, but now, by sticking at it, you have succeeded in making me find you unsettling.

text:
The Toast Identification Swatchcard allows you to tell when the toast has achieved perfect toastiness. The options are (1) Basically untoasted (2) Close (3) Perfect! (4) Dark, but still pretty good. (5) The way Grandpa likes it. and (6) Burnt!
It is laminated so you can hold it up to your toast and not have to worry about Moisture.

name: ratacattt
text:
This week's Achewood has been brought to you by Infectious Mononucleosis (IM) (also known as EBV Infectious Mononucleosis or Pfeiffer's Disease or Filatov's Disease[1] and colloquially as kissing disease%u2014from its oral transmission%u2014or as mono in North America and as glandular fever in other English-speaking countries) , an infectious, very widespread viral disease caused by the Epstein-Barr virus (EBV), one type of herpes virus, to which more than 90% of adults have been exposed.

name: belgand
text:
The worst part of watching hot dogs being made wasn't the meat that went into it. That was fine. I mean, chorizo is made from salivary glands and lymph nodes and announces it proudly on the back of the tube. The worst part was watching the meat get ground into a very fine paste before the addition of corn syrup and some sort of artificial smoking process.

Hickory-smoked horse buttholes would be fine if they were actually smoked.

Ingredients: Buttholes (horse), spices, salt, natural casing.

name: hatstand_mcq
text: I make my own sausages. Normally on Sunday mornings, while my girlfriend is at church, because she hates to see me doing it. This isn't some sort of euphemism by the way. The best one I ever made was hare legs and pork shoulder, with sumac, black pepper and juniper. Lamb neck, anchovy and caper tasted great, but the texture was a bit off. Beef shin and horseradish was a fucking disaster. Basically, there is a good reason why sausages are traditionally made with pork, except among people whose religions ban it, and while you can play silly buggers with the flavorings, you omit the pig at your peril.

name: jeffspaulding

omit the pig at your peril

pork as a main dish is gross tho. i did a pork loin philipino style (broiled, boiled in vinegar, pan fried). next day after cooling, it looked like it'd been hit with pastry glazing machine. just thick white congealed fat. fucking gross.

name: hatstand_mcq
text:
I had some trouble understanding your post due to what I assume was a technical error, but I'll respond to your questions as best I can.
1 - No, not poison sumac. The type of sumac which is used as spice in middle eastern cooking. In future I will be sure to specify, in case any recipe tips I proffer go horribly wrong.
2 - I suspect you are being light-hearted when you aver that guys who make their own sausages are usually 'knee deep in pussy'. Fair enough, but I feel I must point out that on the scale of peculiar things I do, sausage making rates rather lower than posting on a forum about a cat comic (and miles below my habit of sculpting life size models of Dwight Schultz out of soap).

name: desert_donkey
text:
this is now the 2nd best thing i read on the internet (a review of Casey's Irish Pub in downtown Los Angeles
http://www.yelp.com/biz/caseys-irish-bar-and-grille-los-angeles?rpp=40&sort_by=relevance_desc&start=40

Quote:
Ive overheard people talking about Coddle in my office, so I went to the once place that I knew would have it.

Coddle is a form of stew, made in Ireland, with sausages, bacon, onions, potatoes, pepper, and water. You take a saucepan two-thirds full of cold water and add as many sausages as you like, as many slices of back bacon as you like, as many onions as your appetite can handle, and as many peeled floury potatoes as your heart desires. Then you put it on the heat. When it boils, turn down the heat and simmer it for half an hour to ensure that all the pork products cook through.

The culinary-minded will have noticed that at no point do any of the meat products go through the normal processes of browning, searing, crisping, etc., that transform sausage and bacon from mere oversalted lumps of pig into splendid delicacies. No, they are simmered in plain cold water with only potato, onion, pepper, and their own salt for flavoring. No wonder, then, that the sausages come out looking like boiled human penises, while the bacon is flaccid and greasy. Coddle is a really shit meal, the food equivalent of a wet Wednesday afternoon in Bray, which is a small and not very exciting seaside town about 15 miles south of Dublin that's chiefly notable for having a mildly pleasant view of the Irish Sea. It is proof that even traditional cookery with top-grade organic ingredients is perfectly capable of producing something that tastes absolutely fucking disgusting


(from page 2)

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Did they put you in the max security ward with the killers cause you tossed cops around like beanbags?

I met this one Indian guy who'd been transferred there for observation because he ate forks and spoons in prison(to get out of prison for a while). He was a lifer.
He told me about when he was a little boy up in Nebraska he wandered onto the highway on the Res and got hit by a truck. He didn't speak English yet.
They thought he was dead, but when he came to, he spoke this old dialect of Oglallah that the tribal elders barely could recognize. He didn't remember being that kid.
It hadn't been spoken in 500 years. He was a shaman.

He was a 5-year old healer, advising the old men of the tribe. He gradually came back to himself over a few months, forgot the old language.
Then he grew up and became a regular fuckup who killed a guy in a bar fight.

He said he'd never talked about it since until he met me.
Another guy there had been committed by his wife for sexual perversion. He'd gone down on her. One time. His name was Ira. I'm pretty sure he never was released.

Man, Grandpa sure is chatty today, ain't I? :)
